Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then a single CPU core was able to bring the diff back down to normal

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if the big miner is spending Z11 hashrate to strand it and then the blockrate is 40% normal until it readjusts back to a single core

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems there is not much gained for the Z11 guy, if anything he is wasting Z11 hashrate on a CPU mined chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: every 13 minutes, we get 6 new blocks over the next few minutes. so the block pattern is choppy, but a 13 minute pause, 3 minutes fast blocks repeated, this is infinitely better than having to wait a year for the next block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what the adaptivepow does is make extreme hashrate increases, not actually a permanent increase of hashrate as it is diluted rapidly by N*N

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: probably some new math is needed to model it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am coming from an implementors point of view of getting chains unstuck without having to pay for nicehash, and so far it is working as well as i could have expected

Author: zawy#5864
Content: it's on a live coin?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we launched a test chain for this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ./komodod -ac_name=ADAPT -ac_adaptivepow=1 -ac_supply=1000000 -ac_reward=10000000000 -ac_cc=2 -addnode=178.159.11.114 &

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can see at height 526 it was stranded for a day at 20000x, from there single thread CPU brought it back to normal

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: under normal conditions, this adaptive N*N wont even activate

Author: PacificK2A#4591
Content:
Does anyone know where I can find the Komodo address prefixes ? For example with Bitcoin
Pubkey hash (P2PKH address) prefix = 0x00
Private key (WIF, compressed pubkey) prefix = 0x80
Script hash (P2SH address) prefix = 0x05
BIP32 pubkey prefix = 0x0488b21e
BIP32 private key prefix = 0x0488ade4
I think Komodo P2PKH = 3C ? (but the rest I can‚Äôt find)

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content:
Hello all, been on this channel for a while now and need some help of integrating dPOW and AdaptivePoW in our small project. Our company is launching a cryptocurrency based on Cryptonote Protocol/Monero, and and it would really be great if we can have some ideas on how integrate the said technologies in our project, one of which is to prevent 51% attack and another is as what jl777 said about abusive miners trying to increase difficulty and leave the network. Please let me know if how can I start this. This is our project in very buggy stage: https://github.com/abelian-foundation/abelian

Thanks fellow developers

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
@josephnicholas GMT+8 good idea to put timezone in name :)
for dpow integration of cryptonote protocol, #blur is alread developing on that integration.  maybe you can chat to them about it and co-develop the integration

adaptive pow is very freshly in komodo, i cannot comment on it.

if you want those without spending your development time, you can spin up a smart chain in 5 mins and have the same autonomy you currently have, including working on the dilithium stuff.

https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/smart-chains/smart-chain-tutorials/create-a-default-smart-chain.html#part-i-creating-a-new-komodo-smart-chain

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: @Mylo but will I be able to use same codebase that we have in Abelian? We are a pretty new project, and I am the solo developer, so maybe I can work with blur and hopefully be the first adapters of AdaptivePoW.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
komodo code base is komodo code base, zcash fork.   abelian is monero fork.     different code base.   but you get different features and modules on each.   depends what you are building, what advantages different projects have.   i only know komodo in this case.

but just to give you some reference, kava labs went from building on interledger protocol to cosmos because of the base level features they could get to expedite their development.  maybe there are other modules that are applicable for your project that are already coded in komodo other than dpow & adaptive pow which would be useful?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @josephnicholas GMT+8 yes, work with BLUR, that is the best way

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: @jl777c thanks, I already started to contact @Biz in #blur channel. üòÉ

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Re:```
MyloYesterday at 4:24 AM
what are devs thoughts on governance?```
As @Mylo mentioned we have an on-chain voting mechanism in #kmdlabs.
My feeling is that  votes, polls and surveys are all great basic 'tools' that all have their place in governance.
I have made a suggestion that could really use some feedback.  The suggestion is for a way to make use of these various tools for serious and/or controversial issues.
The suggested method is not a governance model, but a tool that could be used in creating such a system, with the aim of minimizing personal conflict through providing focus on issues and ideas rather than personalities.
http://pad.supernet.org/p/KMD_NN_Group_Consensus_Proposal

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Whether 'governance' is needed is something that is up to others to decide.
Having recently become involved in Notary Node matters I certainly see a need for more effective methods to deal with the serious and potentially controversial issues that are sure to arise.  Basic agreed upon and respected tools to deal with such situations may be enough.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
vote delegation might be worth considering also, as it is a feature on other coins, and some would be more interested in letting a trusted person vote on their behalf rather than become embroiled in political debates. 
This idea was something that piqued my interest during the last Aussie election (the last one I paid attention to anyway) https://voteflux.org/about/how/

Content:
@Vic_EXCC txindex is necessary because all the nodes need to validate notarizations
the other indexes are optional for the basic functionality of the chain

the pubkey error message is on a smartchain correct?
if so, it means exactly that, you have to start the chain with a pubkey parameter as it is essential for using Antara modules
https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/antara/antara-tutorials/understanding-antara-addresses.html#creating-and-launching-with-a-pubkey

Author: crumb#2550
Content: @Mylo why restrict those tech tuesday updates only for newsletter subscribers? this is basically "hiding" the progress Komodo team is making. publicly posting them to website blog gives a **much** wider audience. why not post them also publicly?

Author: crumb#2550
Content: creating artificial barriers for following progress. it makes no sense

Author: crumb#2550
Content: rebrand should have nothing to do with it

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content:
Hey @crumb , thanks for the feedback about this. A few points to consider:

-- there will always be a barrier to following Komodo and reading about development and progress. Even visiting the website and taking the time to read the blog post is a barrier

-- We don't want to hide or restrict the TT updates, we want to create an incentive for people to sign up for the email list.

-- if we don't have unique, exclusive content for the newsletter and it's all recycled content/posts/links from the website and Komodo's social media, very few people will read it

-- all important updates and relevant content will of course be published on the website for everyone

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Just a new effort to increase engagement and get more people to follow Komodo and join the community. In the past, the email list has been the same content for everyone. Now, we're looking to provide content that's more customized to people's interests. Developers will get he TT update, Enterprise/Business will get more industry info and competitive analysis, and blockchain enthusiasts will get more info about Komodo, meetups, media coverage, and marketing efforts

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: maybe some people just despise email ü§∑üèΩ

Author: crumb#2550
Content:
sending more customized emails makes sense and you can do that while publicly posting tech tuesdays to website blog while sending customized content to email subscribers.

getting more newsletters subscribers is a good idea, but not at the expense of holding back information. tech tuesdays are an excellent regular read about project progress and good for grassroots social media contributions. personally i've gotten a lot of tweetable stuff from those
